pullRequest.body:
Shows a pro-coyoneda lemma. More precisely:

If `D : Iᵒᵖ ⥤ C` is a diagram and `F : C ⥤ Type` type-valued functor, then homomorphisms from `colimit (D.rightOp ⋙ coyoneda) ⟶ F` are isomorphic to `limit (D ⋙ F ⋙ uliftFunctor)`.

Also shows a variant of this for a covariant diagram `D`.

To establish the pro-coyoneda lemma, some cocontinuity isomorphisms for `Hom` are spelled out.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This is needed for #12843.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks, and sorry for the delay!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9215081037/job/25352669331)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9215081037/job/25352669736)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9215081037/job/25352670062)

What about the analogous lemma for `(limitOpIsoOpColimit F).hom`? Also, this should be tagged with `@[reassoc (attr := simp)]`, not just `simp`. Similarly for the other isomorphisms defined in this file.
Is there a reason this isn't tagged with reassoc/simp? Similarly for `colimitHomIsoLimitYoneda_comp_π`.
Because `by simp` did something (in implicit arguments) here, so I expected the simp NF linter to complain. I just added it, let's see what the linter says.
Linter is happy. Then my strategy of checking for simp NF with `by simp` is flawed.
Do you know about the notation for `Iso.trans`? (Similarly below)
Yes, but I always forget (or maybe never knew) how to type it so I only use it when something to copy paste it from is close. I fixed it in the latest commit.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Limits): pro-coyoneda lemma

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Galois): fundamental group is limit of automorphism groups
